text: Frederick C. Malkus Jr. (July 1, 1913 – November 9, 1999) was a Democratic state legislator from Maryland. He served in the Maryland House of Delegates from 1947 to 1951 and then Maryland State Senate until 1994. When he retired, he had served for 48 years, making him the longest serving legislator in the US.Hoyer, Steny H. "A Tribute To Frederick C. Malkus, Jr." He never lost a re-election bid, though he did lose a 1973 congressional race to Republican Robert E. Bauman. In 1987, a new four-lane U.S. 50 bridge over the Choptank River, the Frederick C. Malkus Bridge, was named in his honor, the first bridge to be named for a living Marylander. ==References== Category:Maryland Democrats Category:Maryland state senators Category:Members of the Maryland House of Delegates Category:1913 births Category:1999 deaths Category:20th- century American politicians
